properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: 10 to 25 mm of rain today over southeastern Manitoba. A disturbance is tracking northeastwards across the Dakotas and Minnesota spreading rain across a large portion of southern Manitoba today. Rainfall amounts of 10 to 25 mm are probable across the Red River valley, Interlake and eastern portions of southern Manitoba before tapering off tonight. Over southeastern Manitoba, a number of areas are already reporting saturated ground conditions and the additional rainfall will likely exacerbate the situation. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-05T21:44:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-05T05:45:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2134727850.2019
Area: R.M. of Ritchot incl. St. Adolphe and Ste. Agathe, R.M. of Tache incl. Lorette Ste-Geneviève and Landmark, R.M. of De Salaberry incl. St-Pierre-Jolys and St. Malo, R.M. of Hanover incl. Steinbach Niverville and Grunthal, R.M. of Ste. Anne incl. Richer, R.M. of La Broquerie incl. Marchand, Mun. of Emerson-Franklin incl. Roseau River, R.M. of Stuartburn incl. Zhoda Vita and Sundown, R.M. of Lac Du Bonnet, L.G. of Pinawa incl. Seven Sisters Falls, R.M. of Whitemouth incl. Forest, R.M. of Piney incl. Sandilands and Sprague

properties.Title: High Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Whiteshell Lakes Area
properties.Summary:
Description: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the Whiteshell Lakes due to heavy rains across Manitoba and northwest Ontario. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as levels and flows are rising. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing water or waters of unknown depth. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe.
Expires: 2019-10-05T16:30:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-10-04T16:01:43-05:00, C214232C-255F-3169-34C6-5BB394BBC4A3
Area: Whiteshell Lakes
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Some plants may be damaged or even destroyed by frost. Frost is possible early this morning. Temperatures are forecast to drop to near the freezing mark early this morning. Persistent light winds and some cloud cover will likely prevent a widespread frost. However, frost is possible in sheltered areas. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-05T20:24:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-05T08:18:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3393503923.2019
Area: Pickering - Oshawa - Southern Durham Region, Vaughan - Richmond Hill - Markham, Wingham - Blyth - Northern Huron County, Listowel - Milverton - Northern Perth County, Goderich - Bluewater - Southern Huron County, Stratford - Mitchell - Southern Perth County, Guelph - Erin - Southern Wellington County, Kitchener - Cambridge - Region of Waterloo, Halton Hills - Milton
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 10 cm is expected. A low pressure system is forecast to develop over southern Alaska today and track eastward along the BC/Yukon border overnight. Cooler northwest winds will develop in its wake and cause the rain to switch to snow near midnight. Snowfall amounts near 10 cm are expected before ending Sunday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-06T09:58:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-05T17:59:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3256292926.2019
Area: Haines Junction, Whitehorse
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential for heavy snow beginning overnight. A Pacific low pressure system is forecast to develop this and track eastward along the BC/Yukon border overnight. Cooler northwest winds will develop in its wake and cause the rain to switch over to snow near or after midnight. Snowfall amounts of up to 10 cm are possible by Sunday morning. The exact amount of snow will depend on the track of this low. If the low's track is further north then the rain will persist longer into the night. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-06T03:43:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-05T11:44:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4001479752.2019
Area: Haines Junction, Whitehorse
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. A cool airmass combined with diminishing winds and clear skies will give patchy frost Sunday morning. Temperatures will remain warmer along parts of the coast. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to PEstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #PEStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-06T10:34:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-05T18:35:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3788337252.2019
Area: Kings County P.E.I., Queens County P.E.I., Prince County P.E.I.

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Persistent fog with visibility near zero is expected or occurring. Dense fog today and Sunday. Dense fog has developed at Coral Harbour early this morning as stagnant and humid conditions linger over the area. While visibilities may improve at times, the fog is generally expected to continue until stronger northerly winds develop Sunday afternoon. ### Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-05T23:52:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-05T07:53:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0379823809.2019
Area: Coral Harbour
